channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Billionaire philanthropist MacKenzie Scott donated $122.6 million to Big Brothers Big Sisters of America, the organization said Tuesday, in the largest donation from one person in the group’s history https://t.co/Yknpx8VUMR
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/O9qPzx44UY https://t.co/LApZgDfvml

The Texas elementary school gunman who shot and killed at least 21 people, including 19 children, also shot his grandmother before going to the school. A relative told The Wall Street Journal on Tuesday that she was in surgery. https://t.co/pi3taYzX9R
President Biden will sign an executive order aimed at increasing police accountability on the second anniversary of George Floyd's killing, people familiar with the matter say https://t.co/yLVC11w74U

The Uvalde, Texas gunman shot his grandmother before going to Robb Elementary School, police said. He used two assault-style rifles purchased at a gun store within a week of his 18th birthday, according to a law-enforcement official. https://t.co/ftVUhU0bEB

“To lose a child is like having a piece of your soul ripped away,” President Biden said of the Texas elementary school shooting Tuesday. “As a nation, we have to ask, when in God’s name are we going to stand up to the gun lobby?” https://t.co/0L1Thqo80d
Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene has easily won the Republican primary for her House seat in northwest Georgia, with nearly half of the vote counted https://t.co/aTB1i2u5QE
The death toll in the Uvalde, Texas elementary school shooting has risen to 19 children and two adults, including a teacher https://t.co/bqYNL5OZo2

Herschel Walker, a former University of Georgia running bank and Heisman Trophy winner, has won Georgia's GOP nomination for Senate, according to the AP. Walker will face Democrat Sen. Raphael Warnock in what's expected to be a close race in the fall. https://t.co/LxMqBtzwNd
The Boss is going back on tour: Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band will be hitting the road starting early next year https://t.co/leQwTtp1j7
The death toll from the shooting at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas has risen to at least 19, including 18 students and one teacher. Here's what we know: https://t.co/T7E9qhqwQw

From @WSJopinion: Nearly two years ago, I wrote in these pages, "I survived cancellation at Princeton." I was wrong. Whoever you are and whatever your beliefs, this should terrify you, writes Joshua Katz. https://t.co/MXxLW8nmqp
“We are shifting from defense to offense. Forces around us are already moving ahead.” Battling a Russian offensive in the Donbas, Ukraine’s forces gear up to strike back. https://t.co/6SyWGTwcZw

Comedian Ricky Gervais is under fire after he made graphic jokes about the transgender community in his new Netflix special, prompting social-media backlash and calls for people to boycott the streaming service https://t.co/zL0LEYwg7p
Breaking: A shooting at a Texas elementary school killed at least two people and sent at least 13 children to the hospital. A suspect is in custody. https://t.co/H5WiBbYiXN

Billionaire philanthropist MacKenzie Scott donated $122.6 million to Big Brothers Big Sisters of America, the organization said Tuesday, in the largest donation from one person in the group’s history https://t.co/suE7tkSYBC
TV comedy “Derry Girls” focuses on Irish teens living their lives during the Troubles. “There’s another side of Derry.” https://t.co/HRK2bC4OWv

Five Republican contenders for governor in Michigan could be disqualified after a state elections bureau said it found tens of thousands of forged signatures gathered by petition circulators https://t.co/C7u9vynKYD
Chinese and Russian strategic bombers flew a joint exercise near Japan while Biden was meeting with the leaders of Australia, Japan and India in Tokyo https://t.co/SeW5aKeaRp

Former White House press secretary Jen Psaki is joining cable news channel MSNBC as an on-air contributor for its political coverage and will also host a new program for Peacock, the NBCUniversal streaming platform https://t.co/gIK1mG4xP9
Trying to speak to an actual person for help with your Facebook account? Just give up. There's no one in customer service to answer your call. https://t.co/vWtKrl7jBU
“I have never been able to speak to a human.” What some of the nearly 3 billion users of Facebook and Instagram learned about the customer helpline: There isn't one. https://t.co/dc5ytq4i4K
The Biden administration is considering a release of diesel fuel from federal reserves to address skyrocketing prices and the threat of supply outages on the East Coast https://t.co/6ZrLhOeq2m
Starbucks joins McDonald’s and other Western companies as it is set to close its business in Russia following Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/1laN4YXrhe

Americans reported the highest level of financial well-being last fall than at any point in almost a decade, according to a Federal Reserve survey, with 78% of adults saying they were either doing OK or living comfortably https://t.co/rbCVGxdlyT
The last of New York’s street pay phones was disconnected, uprooted and lifted into obscurity on Monday https://t.co/UdWKJKGMNg
The top 50 richest people in the world, including Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos and Bill Gates, have lost more than half a trillion dollars on paper this year https://t.co/XSc48oys05
Bridging a river under enemy fire is one of the toughest tasks any land force can face. Russia is offering the world lessons in how not to do it https://t.co/BbyPBXOVKV
The return-to-work rebellion is getting serious, as employees push to make their remote arrangements permanent. https://t.co/YgqufjKlMX
Former world No. 1 Naomi Osaka was eliminated from the French Open in the first round, prolonging the rocky stretch of her career that began in Paris a year ago https://t.co/QawKYEQFKq
From @WSJopinion: It was a mistake for President Biden to exclude Taiwan from the new Indo-Pacific economic framework https://t.co/OggyD3LHxw
Russia is considering scrapping the age limit for enlisting in the military amid reports of heavy casualties in Ukraine. https://t.co/WPgTqUyxfi

The last of New York City’s street pay phones was disconnected, uprooted and lifted into obscurity on Monday. As of March 2015, there were roughly 8,000 public pay phones in use around the city. https://t.co/KfkxtJGMeN

The Czech Republic has donated attack helicopters to Ukraine, and along with Slovakia, has allowed Ukraine’s military to send dozens of armored vehicles across their borders for repairs before they are returned to the conflict https://t.co/SKHbR4Lr5u

Rep. Madison Cawthorn is facing an investigation from his House colleagues into whether he improperly promoted a cryptocurrency and had an inappropriate relationship with a staff member https://t.co/OStbPAHEWa

The last of New York City’s street pay phones was disconnected, uprooted and lifted into obscurity on Monday. As of March 2015, there were roughly 8,000 public pay phones in use around the city. https://t.co/a4tS6Vzqgs

China is flexing its military power in response to growing U.S. support for Taiwan. Here’s a look at the past and present of tensions between China and the U.S. over Taiwan, and what it could mean for the future of the balance of power, in Asia and beyond. https://t.co/m67Pnfzeyt

The attorney general for Washington, D.C. sued Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg on Monday, alleging that he participated in decision-making that led to the Cambridge Analytica data breach (corrects typo) https://t.co/u29psYG6yR

The top 50 richest people in the world, including Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos and Bill Gates, have lost more than half a trillion dollars on paper this year, a loss of wealth that exceeds the GDP of Sweden https://t.co/IQqJIb2lwh
Young people—who have never experienced inflation—don’t really know how to cope, beyond cutting where they can and absorbing the price increases they can’t avoid https://t.co/n8X7p3gr2G

"Money is a fetish, probably the biggest one in the world in a perverted way," said Balenciaga's creative director Demna explaining his decision to show a fetish-inspired collection at the NY Stock Exchange. https://t.co/4a00Rpi3LJ
Starbucks is closing its business in Russia, as the invasion of Ukraine puts an end to its 15-year presence in the market https://t.co/E7VrFL5pK4
A Russian soldier was convicted of premeditated murder and sentenced to life in prison in Ukraine’s first war-crimes trial since the invasion began https://t.co/ausmlzjjeq
To hold down a job these days, a worker seemingly needs one essential trait: a pulse https://t.co/Loyf9k6Oqj
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/DQZP1hlb6Z https://t.co/0XW5Thv8O6
Old Navy made a big bet on inclusive sizes; it backfired. The chain ended up with too many XS and XL clothes, and too few of the rest. https://t.co/1mhs80vMZ2
President Biden said the U.S. would defend Taiwan militarily from aggression from China https://t.co/rXpjDFT6bM
Col. Khallid Shabazz, the U.S. military’s highest-ranking Muslim chaplain, says his job is “to transcend boxes and labels”: “People know I just want to take care of people.” https://t.co/mniKFYQsrK

Women said they left jobs because they were not receiving enough opportunities for career progression, their personal skills were unrewarded, and their work was uninteresting. Many of those problems trace back to the same source: non-promotable work. https://t.co/aDF2edpDPA
Breaking: Justin Thomas won the PGA Championship, coming from behind in the final round to claim his second major title in a playoff https://t.co/gpEDjnmDcg
